intro: Cestrum laevifolium, commonly known as the white cestrum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
